cm.sv: For the law, having a shadow of the good to come, not the very image of the things, can never with the same sacrifices year by year, which they offer continually, make perfect those who draw near. Pues la ley, teniendo una sombra del bien que vendrá, no la imagen misma de las cosas, nunca puede con esos mismos sacrificios que ofrecen cada año, continuamente, perfeccionar a los que se acercan.

Or else wouldn´t they have ceased to be offered, because the worshippers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more consciousness of sins? O de lo contrario habrían cesado de ofrecerse, porque los adoradores, una vez limpios, ya no tendrían conciencia del pecado?
But in those sacrifices there is yearly reminder of sins. Pero en estos se hace memoria de los pecados cada año.
For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins. Porque es imposible que la sangre de toros y cabras quite los pecados.
In whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you had no pleasure. Y las ofrendas quemadas por el pecado no te complacieron.

Then I said, `Behold, I have come (In the scroll of the book it is written of me) Entonces dije, `Observa, he venido (En el rollo del libro está escrito sobre mi)
To do your will, God.´»
A hacer Tu voluntad, Dios.´»

Previously saying, «Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you didn´t desire, neither had pleasure in them» (those which are offered according to the law), Como dijo arriba, «Sacrificios y presentes y ofrendas quemadas y por el pecado no quisiste, ni te complacieron» (las cuales son ofrecidas de acuerdo a la ley),

then he has said, «Behold, I have come to do your will.» He takes away the first, that he may establish the second, entonces dijo, «Observa, he venido a hacer Tu voluntad, Dios.» Elimina el primero, para establecer el segundo,

by which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all. por cuya voluntad somos santificados mediante el ofrecimiento del cuerpo de Jesús Cristo
una sola vez y agregan `por todos.´ .

Every priest indeed stands day by day ministering and often offering the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins, Y, de hecho, todo sacerdote se presenta a diario ministrando y ofreciendo muchas veces los mismos sacrificios, que nunca pueden quitar los pecados,
but he, when he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God; pero Él habiendo ofrecido un sacrificio por los pecados por siempre, se sentó a la diestra de Dios;
from that time waiting until his enemies are made the footstool of his feet. desde entonces esperando hasta que sus enemigos sean puestos por estrado para sus pies.
For by one offering he has perfected forever those who are being sanctified. Pues por una ofrenda ha perfeccionado por siempre a los que son santificados.
The Holy Spirit also testifies to us, for after saying, Y El Espíritu Santo también nos testifica, pues tras decir:

«This is the covenant that I will make with them:
«Este es el pacto que haré con ellos:
`After those days,´ says the Lord,
`Después de esos días,´ dice el Señor,
`I will put my laws on their heart,
`Pondré mis leyes en sus corazones,
I will also write them on their mind;´»
Y en sus mentes las escribiré;´»
then he says,

«I will remember their sins and their iniquities no more.»
«Y sus pecados y sus iniquidades ya no recordaré más.»
Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin. Y donde hay remisión de estos, ya no hay ofrendas por el pecado.
Having therefore, brothers, boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of Jesus, Entonces, hermanos, teniendo confianza para entrar en el lugar santo por la sangre de Jesús,
by the way which he dedicated for us, a new and living way, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;
and having a great priest over the house of God,
let´s draw near with a true heart in fullness of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and having our body washed with pure water,
let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering; for he who promised is faithful.
Let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good works,
not forsaking our own assembling together, as the custom of some is, but exhorting one another; and so much the more, as you see the Day approaching.
For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remains no more a sacrifice for sins,
but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and a fierceness of fire which will devour the adversaries.
A man who disregards Moses´ law dies without compassion on the word of two or three witnesses.

How much worse punishment, do you think, will he be judged worthy of, who has trodden under foot the Son of God, and has counted the blood of the covenant with which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and has insulted the Spirit of grace?
For we know him who said, «Vengeance belongs to me,» says the Lord, «I will repay.» Again, «The Lord will judge his people.»
It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
But remember the former days, in which, after you were enlightened, you endured a great struggle with sufferings;
partly, being exposed to both reproaches and oppressions; and partly, becoming partakers with those who were treated so.
For you both had compassion on me in my chains, and joyfully accepted the plundering of your possessions, knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and an enduring one in the heavens.
Therefore don´t throw away your boldness, which has a great reward.
For you need endurance so that, having done the will of God, you may receive the promise.

«In a very little while,
He who comes will come, and will not wait.

But the righteous will live by faith.
If he shrinks back, my soul has no pleasure in him.»
But we are not of those who shrink back to destruction, but of those who have faith to the saving of the soul.
